get.summary: Retrieve active category node documents by the specified search criteria.
get.description:
Finds active category node documents by parent. Request object containing the parent identifier to search by.
Input parameter:

request: Object containing the parent identifier to search by.

Returns: A page of node objects matching the given search criteria (may be empty).

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The requested page number (starting from zero)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Parent code of the node to search by. If empty, root nodes are returned.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

put.description:
Allows saving multiple category node documents, for example the whole branch in the hierarchy or even the whole tree. Request object containing the category node documents to save.
Input parameter:

request: Object containing the nodes to save.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

409.description: The state of the resource is invalid for the requested operation

get.summary: Get the snapshot based on the provided client snapshot version.
get.description:
A synchronization API that is used to synchronize the category node resource state with the remote client such as POS, Store Server or mobile device.
Input parameter:

request: Object containing request parameters supported for this resource.

Returns: Object with all of the fields of a category node, including read-only system generated/assigned fields.

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit id.

parameters.name: nep-snapshot-version
parameters.description: Version of the client state. This attribute will be used by the back-end to identify the snapshot that should be generated per client. In a simple case, the version is a timestamp (epoch time in millis) and the generated snapshot will contain all documents modified since the provided timestamp.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

409.description: An error occurred while processing a request

get.summary: Retrieve a category node document by the resource identifier.
get.description:
Retrieves full category node document associated with the requested node identifier.
Input parameter:

nodeId: Identifier of the node to retrieve.

Returns: All fields of a category node, including read-only system generated/assigned fields.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: A unique code which is used to identify a node in hierarchy.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

get.description:
Returns ancestry information by the specified category node.
Input parameter:

nodeId: Node identifier for which the ancestry must be returned.

Returns: A snapshot that matches the request parameters (e.g. all category nodes modified since the submitted client version).

post.summary: Receive notification to initialize an export job.
post.description:
Listener API for receiving messaging notifications to initialize a data export job. The provided message should contain all of the details necessary to run the job.
resource_type: resource type used to know the type of resource to be published.
E.g item, item-prices, item-attributes, category-nodes.
snapshot_version: lower bound snapshot version which is the part of data to be published.
E.g 4455454400000, long timestamp.
max_snapshot_version: upper bound snapshot version which is the part of data to be published.
E.g 6655454400000, long timestamp,..
job_type: type of the batch job. E.g COLD_START, WARM_START
Input parameter:

message: The pub/sub message

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

get.summary: Retrieve an active group document by the specified search criteria.
get.description:
Request group document containing the criteria to search.
Input parameter:

request: Object containing the criteria to search by.
Returns: A page of group objects that match the specified search criteria.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The requested page number (starting from zero)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size

parameters.name: titlePattern
parameters.description:
Title pattern to filter the search results. May be null, in that case all groups are returned.Fields named '*Pattern' support wild-card characters.
Examples:
  • titlePattern=group1 (exact match),
  • titlePattern=so* (starts with so),
  • titlePattern=*so* (contains so),
  • titlePattern=* (any value)

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

put.description:

request: Object containing the groups to save.

resource_type: resource type used to know the type of resource.E.g item, item-prices, item-attributes, category-nodes,...

post.summary: Retrieve a collection of matching item attributes or empty collection if no matches were found by the specified request parameters.
post.description:
Retrieves a set of documents for a given set of item identifiers. This API is executed on a context of a single enterprise unit which is expected to be passed as a standard header. The API does not fail if any of the provided item codes do not have corresponding attributes defined at the specified enterprise unit. This API allows clients to orchestrate multiple catalog APIs more effectively. For example, a client may run a search against global items by various supported parameters and then retrieve with a single call all enterprise unit specific attributes (e.g. store level attributes) of the catalog items matched by the previous search. This API has no side-effects.
Input parameters:

request: Identifies context of the client, such as enterprise unit that the client belongs to.
itemIdentifiers: Object containing the item codes to use for the bulk retrieval.

Returns: A collection of objects that represents attributes associated with catalog items at the enterprise unit level.

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit id.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

get.summary: Get the snapshot based on the provided enterprise unit.
get.description:
Item attribute document synchronization API that is used to synchronize the resource state with the remote client such as POS, Store Server or mobile device. This API requires specifying enterprise unit id that matches the client synchronizationsystem (e.g. store server or POS).
Input parameter:

request: Object containing request parameters supported for this resource.

Returns: Snapshot that matches the request parameters (e.g. all item attributes modified since the submitted client version.)

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit id.

parameters.name: nep-snapshot-version
parameters.description: Version of the client state. This attribute will be used by the back-end to identify the snapshot that should be generated per client. In a simple case, the version is a timestamp (epoch time in millis) and the generated snapshot will contain all documents modified since the provided timestamp.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

409.description: An error occurred while processing a request

itemAttributesData: Request object to create an item attribute for an enterprise unit.

get.description:
Retrieves aggregate item data by the provided identifier. Return item is never null

post.summary: Retrieve a collection of matching item price documents or empty collection if no matches were found.
post.description:
Retrieves a set of item price documents for a given set of item identifiers. This API is executed on a context of a single enterprise unit which is expected to be passed as a standard header. The API does not fail if any of the provided item codes do not have corresponding prices defined at the specified enterprise unit. This API allows clients to orchestrate multiple catalog APIs more effectively. For example, a client may run a search against global items by various supported parameters and then retrieve with a single call all prices for a given enterprise unit (e.g. store/site) of the catalog items matched by the previous search. This API has no side-effects.
Input parameters:

request: Identifies context of the client, such as enterprise unit that the client belongs to.
itemIdentifiers: Object containing the item codes to use for bulk retrieval.

Returns: A collection of the matched documents or empty collection if not matches were found.

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit id.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

get.summary: Retrieve an item price document by the item price resource identifier.
get.description:
Retrieves full set of attributes associated with item price. Item price identifier uniquely identifies item price document to retrieve.
Input parameter:

priceIdentifier: uniquely identifies item price to retrieve.

Returns: Object containing complete writable set of attributes for item price.

parameters.name: itemCode
parameters.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the item prices are defined.

parameters.name: priceCode
parameters.description: Identifier of the price provided by the external system. It is expected to be unique in the context of the item and enterprise unit, since each combination of item code, enterprise unit and price identifier are part of the composite id. This identifier is mandatory to facilitate price updates. For example a price scheduled in the future may be cancelled and this is expected to be communicated to the clients that replicate the catalog item price document.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

put.summary: Updates an item price document with the provided item price document input.
put.description:
Provide id item price document containing fields that uniquely define the price object and updates an item's fields for the input item's.
Input parameters:

itemPriceId: Item price data containing fields that uniquely define the price object.
itemPriceData: Item price data containing price information to save.

parameters.name: itemCode
parameters.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the item prices are defined.

parameters.name: priceCode
parameters.description: Identifier of the price provided by the external system. It is expected to be unique in the context of the item and enterprise unit, since each combination of item code, enterprise unit and price identifier are part of the composite id. This identifier is mandatory to facilitate price updates. For example a price scheduled in the future may be cancelled and this is expected to be communicated to the clients that replicate the catalog item price document.

get.summary: Retrieve an item document by the specified search criteria.
get.description:
Finds item documents matching the specified search criteria (also known as standard search).

request: Is the item search criteria.

Returns: A page of item objects that match the specified search criteria.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The requested page number (starting from zero)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size

parameters.name: itemCodePattern
parameters.description: Item Code pattern to use for a search (standard pattern rules apply).

parameters.name: packageIdentifierPattern
parameters.description: Pattern for package identifier (any type) to use for a search (standard pattern rules apply).

parameters.name: longDescriptionPattern
parameters.description: Pattern for long description to use for a search (standard pattern rules apply).

parameters.name: shortDescriptionPattern
parameters.description: Pattern for short description to use for a search (standard pattern rules apply).

parameters.name: itemStatus
parameters.description: Item status to use for a search.

parameters.name: merchandiseCategoryId
parameters.description: Merchandise category code to use for a search. Exact match against the code to which the item belongs or any of the parent nodes.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Specifies the field on which to sort the items.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: Sort direction to the apply to the search results.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

get.summary: Retrieve an item suggestions by the specified search criteria.
get.description:
Retrieves suggestions that fit the provided search criteria.
Input parameter:

request: Is the suggestions search criteria.

Returns: Object containing a page of search results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The requested page number (starting from zero)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size

parameters.name: codePattern
parameters.description: Item Code pattern to use for a search (standard pattern rules apply).

parameters.name: descriptionPattern
parameters.description: Pattern for long description to use for a search (standard pattern rules apply)

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Sort field to apply to the retrieved items.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: Sort direction to apply to the retrieved items.

parameters.name: merchandiseCategoryId
parameters.description: Merchandise category node id. If provided the search will be restricted to just the items that fall into this category. The provided code must be an exact match for either the merchandise category node to which the item  belongs or to any of the ancestors.

put.description:
Allows saving a link group. if enterprise unit header is specified with the request, the object is saved with the specified enterprise unit making the link group applicable only for the specified unit (site/store).
Input parameters:

linkGroupCode: Request containing link group identifier and optional enterprise unit information.
linkGroup: Object containing the link group to save.

parameters.name: linkGroupCode
parameters.description: A unique (per tenant) link group code that identifies the link group.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

lastUpdated.description: Date when the object was last updated.

lastUpdatedByUser.description: User name of the user that updated the object.

AuditTrailData.description: Audit related information that can be associated with objects.

DynamicAttributesData.description: Contains basic fields describing the dynamic attributes.

groupCode.description: Group code that uniquely identifies the group per tenant.

GroupIdData.description: Represents minimum set of fields that uniquely identifies Group.

itemCode.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

enterpriseUnitId.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the item attributes are defined.

ItemAttributesIdData.description: Id data that defines attributes associated with a catalog item at the enterprise unit level. For example, for retail catalog these attributes will represent store level item configuration.

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

inVariety.description: Attribute that identifies whether the catalog item is generally available (in variety) in the respect enterprise unit (store, site, branch, etc.). If this attribute is set to false, then data synchronization logic for item catalog (specifically {@link ItemService#getSnapshot(com.ncr.nr1.catalog.common.GetSnapshotRequest)}) may takethis attribute into account for distributions that are requested in a context of an enterprise unit. In this case, the catalog items distributed to the enterprise unit are restricted only to those that have this attribute set to {@code true} in the item attributes.

status.description:
Status of the current item attributes. If set to INACTIVE, it means that item is not available for the specified unit. This approach allows to apply restrictions at the enterprise unit and also maintain information about the products that are 'sold' at a specific location.
Supported types:
  • ACTIVE: Indicates that object is not active.
  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.

groups.description: Collection of groups that represents group memberships of the catalog item (enterprise unit level).

linkGroups.description: Collection of linked items that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

itemAttributesId.description: Identifier object that specifies item code and enterprise unit for the attributes object.

ItemAttributesViewData.description: Contains all of the fields of a catalog item attributes, including read-only system generated/assigned fields.

linkGroupCode.description: A unique (per tenant) link group code that identifies the link group.

LinkGroupIdData.description: Represents minimum set of fields that uniquely identify a link group.

key.description: Key that identifies this key value pair.

localizedValue.description: Optional value that can be used to transfer multi-language attributes in a single structure. Note that if the client reads data and specifies the language, the data returned by the API may simply use the value from the super type {@code KeyValueData}.

LocalizedKeyValueData.description: Contains locale, key and value properties.

value.description: Value has range of the name.

values.description: Values containing entries per language (one entry per language is expected).

MultiLanguageTextData.description: Generic data type that is capable of holding text data in multiple languages.

nodeId.description: A unique code which is used to identify a node in hierarchy.

NodeIdData.description: Data Object to identify a node in hierarchy uniquely.

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

inVariety.description: Attribute that identifies whether the catalog item is generally available (in variety) in the respect enterprise unit (store, site, branch, etc.). If this attribute is set to false, then data synchronization logic for item catalog (specifically {@link ItemService#getSnapshot(com.ncr.nr1.catalog.common.GetSnapshotRequest)}) may takethis attribute into account for distributions that are requested in a context of an enterprise unit. In this case, the catalog items distributed to the enterprise unit are restricted only to those that have this attribute set to {@code true} in the item attributes.

status.description:
Status of the current item attributes. If set to INACTIVE, it means that item is not available for the specified unit. This approach allows to apply restrictions at the enterprise unit and also maintain information about the products that are 'sold' at a specific location.
Supported types:
  • ACTIVE: Indicates that object is not active.
  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.

groups.description: Collection of groups that represents group memberships of the catalog item (enterprise unit level).

linkGroups.description: Collection of linked items that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

ItemAttributesData.description: Defines complete set of properties for item attributes.

itemAttributes.description: Objects in the page of search results.

GetItemAttributesResponse.description: A collection of objects that represents attributes associated with catalog items at the enterprise unit level.

itemIds.description: Maximum number of identifiers to support in the request.

ItemIdCollectionData.description: A request to support bulk get of catalog item attributes defined at the enterprise unit level.

itemCode.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

ItemIdData.description: Data object to identify an item uniquely.

snapshot.description: Objects in the page of search results.

GetItemAttributesSnapshotResponse.description: List of Item-Attribute records for get request.

key.description: Key that identifies this key value pair.

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

nodeCode.description: Language independent code which is used to identify a node in hierarchy. Expected to be human-readable, non-localized identifier unique in the scope of its parent.

tag.description: Tag to mark the node. This tag is expected to be understood by the client.

departmentNode.description: Indicates if this node represents a department.

status.description:
Node status. If set to inactive, indicates that the node is 'deleted' and should not be assigned to the catalog items.
Supported types:
  • ACTIVE: Indicates that object is not active.
  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.

merchandiseCategory.description: Merchandise category identifier with the ancestry.

familyCode.description: The family code of the item.

manufacturerCode.description: The manufacture code of the item.

ItemBasicViewData.description: Data object contains basic view properties for item.

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

linkGroupType.description:
Type of the link group. May drive behavior of the POS / Client when an item associated with the link group is selected for ordering.
Supported types:
  • DEPOSIT: Identifies a linked deposit, such as bottle deposit, CRV
  • MODIFIER: Identifies items that maybe used to modify the order (ingredients, warranty, activation cards, etc.)
  • SUGGESTION: Identifies suggestions that may be presented to the user. These suggestions are 'statically' defined in the catalog, as opposed to the suggestions that are dynamic in nature and depend on the transaction context (consumer information, targeted advertisement, etc.).
  • SUBSTITUTION: Identifies items that may be used as substitutions for a given item.
  • CUSTOM: Custom group type. The API client is expected to understand how handle this type of link groups.

tag.description: Tag to mark the group. This tag is expected to be understood by the client. Tag defines the type of the link group: suggestion, substitutes, kit, deposit, etc.

status.description:
Link group status. If set to inactive, indicates that the link group is 'deleted' and should not be assigned to the catalog items attributes.
Supported types:
  • ACTIVE: Indicates that object is not active.
  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.

restriction.description: Link restrictions that allows to specify whether items must be sold, how many must be sold, min/max quantities.

linkItems.description: Collection of linked items that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

substitutionGroup.description: Option substitution group that indicates that items from this link group can be substituted with items of the referenced group.

enterpriseUnitId.description: Enterprise unit identifier that may be used for filtering of the link groups that are relevant for the caller. It is assumed that if a request to get link groups is provided with the enterprise unit specified, then all link groups that match the enterprise unit exactly, or groups with the enterprise units that are parents of the provided enterprise unit or all groups that don't have enterprise unit specified (global groups) are applicable.

LinkGroupViewData.description: Represents a complete set of attributes for a link group of catalog items, including read-only and system defined fields.

maxQuantity.description: Restriction defining the maximum of item instances (portions, units) can be provided as a part of the link.

minQuantity.description: Restriction defining the minimum number of item instances (portions, units) that can be provided as part of the link (group or individual item). For example, the setting of 1 will require at least one item instances to be included with the link. It can be used to define kits or strong linkage such as bottle deposit that must be sold along with the item.

freeQuantity.description: Restriction defining the number of item instances (portions, units) that can be provided free as part of the link (group or individual item). For example, the setting of 1 means that one item instance is provided at no charge.

defaultQuantity.description: Default setting of the restriction (the client will apply this setting by default). In a general case it should not contradict the min/max restrictions, however, the service will not enforce this validation.

LinkRestrictionData.description: Represents restrictions that are set at the link item or group level.

itemCode.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

dynamicAttributes.description: Dynamic attributes stored at the linked group level. These may contain domain-specific attributes such as maxportions (e.g. two portions of ketchup are allowed with one sale of a hamburger.

LinkedItemReferenceData.description: Represents a denormalized reference to a linked item. Item linking allows creating product kits: e.g. products that together present a single offering. For example TV-set and warranty, hamburger and ketchup.

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

linkGroupType.description:
Type of the link group. May drive behavior of the POS / Client when an item associated with the link group is selected for ordering.
Supported types:
  • DEPOSIT: Identifies a linked deposit, such as bottle deposit, CRV
  • MODIFIER: Identifies items that maybe used to modify the order (ingredients, warranty, activation cards, etc.)
  • SUGGESTION: Identifies suggestions that may be presented to the user. These suggestions are 'statically' defined in the catalog, as opposed to the suggestions that are dynamic in nature and depend on the transaction context (consumer information, targeted advertisement, etc.).
  • SUBSTITUTION: Identifies items that may be used as substitutions for a given item.
  • CUSTOM: Custom group type. The API client is expected to understand how handle this type of link groups.

  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.

linkItems.description: Collection of linked items that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

substitutionGroup.description: Option substitution group that indicates that items from this link group can be substituted with items of the referenced group.

LinkGroupData.description: Link groups allow linking catalog items with other items to implement use cases such as kits, suggestions, substitutes.

enterpriseUnitId.description: Enterprise unit identifier that may be used for filtering of the link groups that are relevant for the caller. It is assumed that if a request to get link groups is provided with the enterprise unit specified, then all link groups that match the enterprise unit exactly, or groups with the enterprise units that are parents of the provided enterprise unit or all groups that don't have enterprise unit specified (global groups) are applicable.

LinkGroupBasicViewData.description: Data object contains basic view properties for link group.

itemCode.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

enterpriseUnitId.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the item prices are defined.

priceCode.description: Identifier of the price provided by the external system. It is expected to be unique in the context of the item and enterprise unit, since each combination of item code, enterprise unit and price identifier are part of the composite id. This identifier is mandatory to facilitate price updates. For example a price scheduled in the future may be cancelled and this is expected to be communicated to the clients that replicate the catalog item price document.

ItemPriceIdData.description: Id of item price document that defines prices associated with a catalog item at the enterprise unit level. Each item can have more thana single price associated with it at the enterprise unit level.

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

Supported types:

  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.
